algorithm_technique: Two-pointer iteration with run-length encoding manipulation.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the element-wise product of two arrays represented in run-length encoded format.
problem_summary_technical: Iterates through both encoded arrays using two pointers, calculating products of segments and merging consecutive identical products.
key_insights: The problem can be solved without fully expanding the RLE arrays, saving significant memory and time.
A two-pointer approach is efficient for iterating through both encoded arrays simultaneously.
Careful management of remaining counts and merging of consecutive identical products in the result is key to an optimal solution.
